item.title: Report X-2024070621
item.description:
Report X-2024070621

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKIING HAZMAT. DESIGNATE RESPONDER FOUND PACKAE ON THE FLOOR WITH A COUPLE OF THE CORNERS WET. WHEN PACKAGE WAS OPENED A SMALL AMOUNT OF FLUID WAS LEAKING FRON THE CLOSURE. FOLLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS, PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED.

item.title: Report E-2024070162
item.description:
Report E-2024070162

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: CHINA GROVE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 27, 2024, one (1) 15-gallon pail of UN3266 was damaged due to unknown causes and released approximately one (1) pint of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. After locating the damaged product, FCE wiped down the impacted pallet and floor. The absorbent rags, and damaged product were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.
